translation.en: They all look so tiny.
A feather!
Yes!
I did it!
I've flown with the Great Condor!
translation.de: Ich flog mit dem Großen Kondor!

translation.en: Hey! Not him again!
He's trampling our crops!
-I can't believe it! -He's gonna ruin everything!
Get out of there!
Come here, little llamas!
No.
Come on! Listen!
Yes! Good boys.
Naïra, look!
-I have a feather from the Great Condor! -Stop it! You're frightening them!
translation.de: -Eine Feder vom Großen Kondor. -Schreck sie nicht auf.

translation.en: You can be such a pain.
-Look! -Tepulpaï!
-Go play somewhere else. -I've flown with the Great Condor!
translation.de: -Spiel woanders. -Ich flog mit dem Großen Kondor.

translation.en: Shaman!
Shaman?
Shaman?
Only the mountain wind may enter my house without being invited.
translation.de: Nur der Bergwind darf ohne Einladung eintreten.

translation.en: But, Shaman... I flew with the Great Condor! Look!
translation.de: Aber ich flog mit dem Großen Kondor. Hier!

translation.en: He gave me a feather.
Really? You flew with the Great Condor?
translation.de: Ach ja? Du bist mit dem Großen Kondor geflogen?

translation.en: -Yes. -And he gave you a feather?
translation.de: Ja. Und er gab dir eine Feder?

translation.en: Unbelievable. Am I a shaman now, Shaman?
Do you believe a feather is enough to make a shaman out of you?
translation.de: Meinst du, eine Feder macht dich zum Schamanen?

translation.en: Your time would be better spent thinking
about what you plan to offer to Pachamama tomorrow.
You know your offering must be your most precious treasure.
translation.de: Du musst das opfern, was dir am meisten bedeutet.

translation.en: Tepulpaï, come help us.
translation.de: Tepulpaï, komm her und hilf uns.

translation.en: Not again.
I hate scrubbing potatoes.
How's a potato born, Walumama? Now, this is a very good question.
translation.de: -Woher kommen Kartoffeln, Walumama? -Das ist eine gute Frage.

translation.en: Let us see if Naïra here can answer it for us,
since she will soon become a Great One.
translation.de: da sie ja bald eine Große sein wird.

translation.en: Potatoes grow in our fields, just like quinoa and corn.
translation.de: Kartoffeln wachsen auf Feldern wie Quinoa und Mais.

translation.en: First they appear as little, tiny seeds. Pachamama buries them in her belly.
translation.de: Anfangs sind es kleine Samen, die Pachamama im Leib trägt.

translation.en: She nourishes and protects them until the harvest season.
translation.de: Sie nährt und schützt sie bis zur Erntezeit.

translation.en: Just like a mother does with her baby.
We are all children of Pachamama.
That is why we must love her as much as she loves us.
translation.de: Deshalb müssen wir sie so lieben, wie sie uns liebt.

translation.en: What about you, Tepulpaï?
Tell us how we shall show our gratitude to Pachamama for this abundant crop.
translation.de: Sag uns, wie wir Pachamama für diese reiche Ernte danken sollen.

translation.en: Tomorrow there is the ceremony. I'll make my first offering, and so will Naïra.
translation.de: Morgen ist das Fest. Naïra und ich opfern das erste Mal etwas.

translation.en: And bang, after that, we become Great Ones, and that's it.
translation.de: Danach gehören wir zu den Großen, und das war's.

translation.en: Tepulpaï, are you sleeping?
-I'm dreaming. -You're not sleeping, but you're dreaming?
translation.de: Ich träume. Du bist wach und träumst?

translation.en: -That way, I can have any dream I want. -And what are you dreaming about?
translation.de: -So kann ich träumen, was ich will. -Wovon träumst du?

translation.en: Let's hurry. Mama Quilla is now high in the sky.
translation.de: Schnell, Mama Quilla steht hoch am Himmel.

translation.en: Come.
What are you gonna ask from Pachamama tomorrow?
You didn't get it, did you?
Offerings are not about asking but about thanking.
translation.de: Es geht nicht ums Bitten, sondern ums Danken.

translation.en: You know everything, don't you, Miss Perfect?
translation.de: Du weißt wohl alles, du Genie.

translation.en: Watch out, there's snakes!
The snakes are the keepers of our cave.
translation.de: Das sind die Hüter der Höhlen.

translation.en: They can recognize who is ready to appear before our ancestors.
translation.de: Sie erkennen, wer bereit ist, unsere Ahnen zu treffen.

translation.en: You must trust them.
Wait for me here.
Beloved ancestors, I come to disturb your peaceful rest
translation.de: Geliebte Ahnen, ich störe euren Frieden nur,

translation.en: only to ask you to entrust me with the huaca.
translation.de: um euch zu bitten, mir die Huaca anzuvertrauen.

translation.en: Thank you, ancestors, for your kindness.
I will return it after the ceremony.
translation.de: Nach dem Fest bringe ich sie zurück.

translation.en: Thank you, Mama Quilla, for illuminating our cave.
translation.de: Danke, Mama Quilla, dass du uns Licht schenkst.

translation.en: Your children are all gathered here to honor and thank you for this harvest.
translation.de: Deine Kinder sind hier versammelt, um dir für diese Ernte zu danken.

translation.en: Now, bring forth the huaca.
Our huaca protects our village.
Our ancestors shaped her and placed within her our most precious treasure.
translation.de: Unsere Ahnen formten sie und verbargen unseren wertvollsten Schatz in ihr.

translation.en: Wow! But, what treasure?
Oh, Pachamama,
we return to you all that which you have given to us.
translation.de: Wir geben dir all das zurück, das du uns gegeben hast.

translation.en: Potatoes,
quinoa,
and corn.
May these offerings feed your belly.
Naïra and Tepulpaï have grown strong and healthy thanks to you.
translation.de: Naïra und Tepulpaï sind dank dir stark und gesund.

translation.en: The time has come for them to make their first offering
translation.de: Heute bringen sie dir ihr erstes Opfer,

translation.en: as a token of gratitude to you.
translation.de: um sich bei dir zu bedanken.

translation.en: Me first.
you must offer to Pachamama the most precious thing you have.
translation.de: du musst Pachamama das geben, was dir am meisten bedeutet.

translation.en: But this is all I have.
I have a feeling you can do better.
translation.de: Ich glaube, dass du etwas Besseres hast.

translation.en: No! Not my feather! I only got one.
translation.de: Nein, nicht meine Feder. Ich habe nur eine.

translation.en: This fruit isn't ripe yet.
translation.de: Diese Frucht ist noch nicht reif.

translation.en: It'll have to wait until the next harvest.
translation.de: Sie muss bis zur nächsten Ernte warten.

translation.en: Tepulpaï is not a Great One yet!
Come, Naïra.
Pachamama, this is Lamita.
She's the most precious thing I have.
Pachamama! Must the blood of this llama be shed?
translation.de: Pachamama, muss das Blut des Lamas vergossen werden?

translation.en: Pachamama is so deeply moved
that she is shedding her own tears upon our village.
translation.de: dass sie Tränen über unser Dorf vergießt.

translation.en: Your llama shall be spared.
-Now you are a Great One. -Lamita!
That's my feather.
I hate ceremonies.
What?
Oh, a quirquincho.
Sorry. I took you for a stone.
translation.de: Verzeih, ich hielt dich für einen Stein.

translation.en: Let me get you...
Hey, want to dance again?
No, I'm not ready.
Already?
We barely finished picking our crops.
It's the Great Collector of the Great Inca.
translation.de: Es ist der Eintreiber des Großen Inka.

translation.en: May our sun god, Inti, illuminate all of you, and woe to the thief, the liar...
translation.de: Möge unser Sonnengott euch erleuchten, und wehe dem Dieb, dem Lügner

translation.en: and the lazy man.
I come to collect that which is due to his son, the Great Inca.
translation.de: Ich hole, was dem Großen Inka zusteht.

translation.en: We have worked hard, and we had an abundant harvest.
translation.de: Wir haben hart gearbeitet und eine reiche Ernte eingefahren.

translation.en: What? You have thrown all that away?
translation.de: Was? Das werft ihr alles weg?

translation.en: -What a waste! -We did not throw it away.
Whatever we give to Pachamama comes back to us.
Such primitive, barbarian traditions!
Here is the portion we have set aside for you.
Who are you to decide what is due to the Great Inca?
translation.de: Woher wisst ihr, was dem Großen Inka zusteht?

translation.en: You must give as many bags as there are knots in my quipu,
translation.de: Wir erhalten die Anzahl der Knoten in meinem Quipu.

translation.en: and this is not enough!
-No one can be worse than these Incas! -They're taking away all our crops.
translation.de: Die Inkas sind gierig. Sie nehmen uns alles weg.

translation.en: We'll have nothing left to eat.
We're lucky they can't take our fields away.
You had more than enough, but you chose to dump everything down into that hole.
translation.de: Ihr hattet mehr als genug, habt es aber in ein Loch geworfen.

translation.en: You wretched peasants are too generous with your Pachamama.
translation.de: Ihr elenden Bauern seid zu großzügig zu eurer Pachamama.

translation.en: They are offerings so that she might protect our village.
translation.de: Es sind Opfer, damit sie uns beschützt.

translation.en: Silence, old fool! The only one who protects you is the Great Inca!
translation.de: Schweig, Närrin! Nur der Große Inka beschützt euch.

translation.en: He builds the roads and illuminates the world!
translation.de: Er baut die Straßen und erleuchtet die Welt.

translation.en: This statuette makes you all stupid. I am confiscating it.
translation.de: Die Statue verblödet euch. Ich konfisziere es.

translation.en: -No! -You cannot do that.
You don't get to decide.
I will offer it to the Great Inca as a sign of submission from your village.
translation.de: Ich opfere es dem Großen Inka als Zeichen der Unterwerfung eures Dorfs.

translation.en: -Walumama! -Is she all right?
-Is she okay? -What happened?
I hate the Incas!
Let's go attack them by surprise and squish them!
Vengeance is not in the spirit of the Condor.
translation.de: Rache ist nicht im Sinne des Kondors.

translation.en: But we can't just sit around and do nothing! We have to get the huaca back!
translation.de: -Aber wir müssen etwas tun. -Die Huaca zurückholen.

translation.en: I will see to that. As soon as Walumama no longer needs my care.
translation.de: Ich überlege mir was, wenn es Walumama besser geht.

translation.en: But, Shaman, if we wait too long, we'll never catch them.
They'll get to Cusco and give the huaca to the Great Inca. Then it'll be too late.
translation.de: In Cusco opfern sie die Huaca. Dann ist sie verloren.

translation.en: Can't you just listen to the shaman without arguing for a change?
translation.de: Hör doch ein Mal auf den Schamanen.

translation.en: Who asked you, Miss Perfect?
Let Walumama get some rest.
But, Shaman, I... Go to bed, now!
Listen to the shaman, will you?
Great Condor, help me find the huaca.
translation.de: Großer Kondor, hilf mir, die Huaca zu finden.

translation.en: You're back. So you're not mad at me, after all?
translation.de: Da bist du wieder. Du bist mir nicht böse?

translation.en: Come on. I'll show the shaman what I'm capable of. You're coming with me?
translation.de: Ich zeige dem Schamanen, was ich kann. Kommst du mit?

translation.en: The road to Cusco!
The city of the Inca.
Lucky you. You can eat whatever you find.
I hate dandelion.
Make way for the chasqui, the messenger of the Inca!
translation.de: Macht Platz für den Chasqui, dem Boten der Inka.

translation.en: Hey, chasqui! Got any food or drink for me?
translation.de: Hey, Chasqui, hast du was zu essen oder zu trinken?

translation.en: Don't steal, don't lie,
and don't be lazy!
What, Kirkincho?
No way. I'm not carrying you. I'm tired.
translation.de: Nein, ich trage dich nicht. Ich bin erschöpft.

translation.en: Come on, move.
Llama's hair.
The Incas have crossed here.
Great Condor, make me strong.
Tepulpaï, wait up!
What are you doing here?
I'm coming with you, and so is Lamita.
The shaman sent you to spy on me, right? He did not. He doesn't even know I'm here.
translation.de: -Schickt dich der Schamane? -Nein, er weiß nicht, dass ich hier bin.

translation.en: I see. So, now Miss Perfect is disobeying the shaman.
Well, yes. Someone must bring the huaca back to the village.
translation.de: Ja, jemand muss ja die Huaca zurückholen.

translation.en: Kirkincho and I, we don't need any help. Especially from you!
translation.de: Wir brauchen keine Hilfe. Schon gar nicht von dir!

translation.en: Don't leave me.
See? You're such a coward, you can't even cross the bridge.
translation.de: Siehst du? Du hast sogar Angst vor Brücken.

translation.en: She's way too scared.
Come on. Let's go.
I'm so hungry.
Wait for us.
You again?
translation.de: Du schon wieder? Geh nach Hause!

translation.en: -Go back to the village! -We're coming with you.
translation.de: Du schon wieder? Geh nach Hause! Wir kommen mit dir.

translation.en: -You can't stop us. -No way!
translation.de: Wir kommen mit dir. Nein, ihr seid zu langsam. Ich brauche euch nicht.

translation.en: You'll slow us down. I don't need you.
translation.de: Nein, ihr seid zu langsam. Ich brauche euch nicht.

translation.en: Listen, Mr. Rude. We didn't walk all this way for nothing.
translation.de: Hör zu, du Rohling, wir sind nicht umsonst hier.

translation.en: And don't tell me you don't need this.
translation.de: Und ich glaube, das brauchst du schon.

translation.en: This is good.
Thank you, Pachamama,
for feeding us and giving us strength for this journey.
translation.de: dass du uns nährst und Kraft gibst.

translation.en: Right. We have no time for ceremony. The Incas aren't gonna wait for us.
translation.de: Ja. Keine Zeit für Förmlichkeiten. Die Inka warten nicht.

translation.en: All right, we'll go together.
But I make the decisions,
and I bring the huaca back to the village.
With you, it's always, "I." You're so selfish.
translation.de: Ich höre immer nur "ich". Du bist so ein Egoist.

translation.en: Yeah, Miss Perfect.
Talking is not gonna help us catch up with the Incas. We must go.
translation.de: Durch Worte holen wir die Inka nicht ein. Wir müssen los.

translation.en: Make way for the chasqui of the Inca!
translation.de: Macht Platz für den Chasqui der Inka.

translation.en: Look at those stars above our village.
translation.de: Da, die Sterne über dem Dorf.

translation.en: They're the stars of the Great Condor. Can you see them?
translation.de: Die Sterne des Großen Kondor. Siehst du sie?

translation.en: Are you dreaming again?
You know, I can't stop thinking about Walumama.
translation.de: Ich muss die ganze Zeit an Walumama denken.

translation.en: She was so ill when I left the village.
Don't worry. I'm sure the shaman will heal her.
translation.de: Keine Angst, der Schamane heilt sie.

translation.en: What if he doesn't?
And what if we don't find our huaca?
translation.de: Was, wenn wir die Huaca nicht finden?

translation.en: What are we gonna do?
Look! Over there!
One of the stars is dancing.
Come on. Let's take advantage of the night to find the Incas.
translation.de: Los, wir nutzen die Nacht, um die Inka zu suchen.

translation.en: The Incas.
They've gone into the sea of clouds.
-Let's go. -No, wait.
There's so many of them. They're stronger, and they've got weapons.
translation.de: Es sind so viele. Sie sind stärker und bewaffnet.

translation.en: How are we gonna do this?
We'll just come from behind. Quiet and slow.
They won't see us with all these clouds.
Come on, Great Condor. Guide us through the clouds.
translation.de: Los, Großer Kondor, führe uns durch die Wolken.

translation.en: Where are you?
Are you okay?
Yes.
The Incas are so loud. We can't miss them.
translation.de: Die Inka sind so laut. Das hilft uns.

translation.en: Listen, it's this way.
We must stick to the trail. Otherwise...
translation.de: Wir müssen dem Pfad folgen, oder...

translation.en: But... the trail is gone!
Can you hear? Over there!
Tepulpaï, look at Lamita.
It's this way.
Okay, let's go.
Not that way!
Thank you, Lamita. We're so lucky you're here.
translation.de: Danke, Lamita. Zum Glück haben wir dich.

translation.en: Walumama always says that whenever you're scared,
translation.de: Walumama sagt immer, wenn man Angst hat,

translation.en: you should breathe deeply to remind yourself that you're alive.
translation.de: muss man atmen, damit man weiß, dass man lebt.

translation.en: I'm not afraid.
Yuck!
Oh, no! I think I stepped on a...
translation.de: Oh nein, ich glaube, das war...

translation.en: Yes! I know how to find the Incas.
translation.de: Ja! So finden wir die Inka.

translation.en: All we have to do is follow their llamas' droppings.
translation.de: Wir müssen nur den Kötteln ihrer Lamas folgen.

translation.en: Come on. Follow me!
I hate the Incas... and their llamas!
translation.de: Ich hasse die Inka und ihre Lamas.

translation.en: The City of the Sun.
It's shaped like a puma.
translation.de: Sie sieht wie ein Puma aus.

translation.en: And it's... glittering.
It's too late. They've arrived. They're going to meet with the great Inca.
translation.de: Zu spät. Sie sind da. Gleich treffen sie den Großen Inka.

translation.en: -All is lost. -We're not giving up!
Hold on! We're not just going to jump into the mouth of the Puma.
translation.de: Warte! Wir springen nicht ins Maul des Pumas.

translation.en: I told you that it wouldn't be easy. No one forced you to come.
translation.de: Es wird nicht leicht, aber du wolltest ja mit.

translation.en: May I remind you that, without us,
translation.de: Hast du vergessen, dass du dir ohne uns das Genick gebrochen hättest?

translation.en: you would have fallen down and broken your neck in that sea of clouds.
translation.de: dass du dir ohne uns das Genick gebrochen hättest?

translation.en: You should think twice before making decisions.
translation.de: Du solltest nachdenken, bevor du handelst.

translation.en: Think twice?
We are never gonna get our huaca back just by think twicing.
translation.de: Durch Nachdenken kriegen wir die Huaca auch nicht zurück.

translation.en: Make way for the... chasqui of the Inca.
translation.de: Macht Platz für den Chasqui der Inka.

translation.en: What happened to you?
I've come from the shore with a message for the Great Inca.
translation.de: Ich komme mit einer Botschaft für den Großen Inka.

translation.en: A floating house has arrived on the waters.
translation.de: Ein schwimmendes Haus liegt vor unserer Küste.

translation.en: Beings from another world. Monsters with metal skins.
translation.de: Wesen aus einer anderen Welt, Ungeheuer mit Haut aus Metall.

translation.en: They spit fire, and...
And what?
-And we must... -Must what?
We must deliver the message to the Great Inca.
Isn't that what a chasqui's supposed to do?
Yes.
Is he--?
I think he's gone to meet his ancestors.
translation.de: Ich glaube, er ist bei seinen Ahnen.

translation.en: His pututu.
Tepulpaï. What is it?
Those gods are really... mighty gods.
So if the Great Inca needs to hear this message, right?
translation.de: Der Große Inka muss diese Botschaft hören.

translation.en: And we need to get our huaca back... can't we make some kind of trade?
translation.de: Wir wollen unsere Huaca. Schlagen wir einen Handel vor.

translation.en: Now, that, Naïra, that is some great think twicing.
translation.de: Also das, Naïra, war wirklich gut nachgedacht.

translation.en: I'm taking the pututu. What about this poor man?
translation.de: -Ich bringe ihnen das Pututu. -Was ist mit ihm?

translation.en: Well... He's come all that way to deliver this message.
translation.de: Nun, er kam her, um die Botschaft zu überbringen.

translation.en: So now, it's up to us to finish his mission.
We won't let you down, brave chasqui. You'll be proud of us.
translation.de: Wir helfen dir, Chasqui. Du wirst stolz sein.

translation.en: Come on. Let's hurry, Naïra.
Pachamama, watch over him.
Easy, Lamita. They're not real pumas. They're just Inca guards.
translation.de: Keine Angst, das sind keine Pumas, nur Inka-Wachen.

translation.en: Don't show them we're afraid, or else they won't let us through.
translation.de: Wenn wir Angst zeigen, lassen sie uns nicht durch.

translation.en: Now we are the chasquis.
May our god Inti illuminate you, travelers,
and may the thief, the liar, and the lazy man be punished.
translation.de: und Diebe, Lügner und Faulpelze bestrafen.

translation.en: Make way!
Fresh fish for the Great Inca!
translation.de: Frische Fische für den Großen Inka.

translation.en: They are on their way to see the Great Inca.
Let's follow them.
Wow! The Temple of the Sun.
That is a very high house.
translation.de: Das ist ein sehr, sehr hohes Gebäude.

translation.en: It's high enough to be closer to his father, Inti.
translation.de: So ist er näher bei seinem Vater Inti.

translation.en: Yes, but... all those stairs to get up there!
translation.de: Ja, aber das sind so viele Stufen.

translation.en: How does he do that?
No idea.
Besides, they say he never touches the ground.
translation.de: Man sagt auch, dass er nie den Boden berührt.

translation.en: It's too dirty for him.
Make way for the chasquis of the Inca!
translation.de: Macht Platz für die Chasquis der Inka.

translation.en: If you're a chasqui, then I'm a llama.
translation.de: Wenn du ein Chasqui bist, bin ich ein Lama.

translation.en: We have the pututu.
He claims to be a chasqui? Then let him prove it.
translation.de: Wenn er ein Chasqui sein will, soll er es beweisen.

translation.en: What on Earth was that?
translation.de: Was in aller Welt war das?

translation.en: Any chasqui who blows into the pututu may enter the temple,
translation.de: Wer in das Pututu bläst, darf in den Tempel,

translation.en: regardless of his size.
You may enter, chasqui!
Next!
Great Inca, here is some medicine prepared by our shaman
translation.de: Großer Inka, unser Schamane schickt euch Medizin

translation.en: from the bark and roots of the Kuntisuyu, a plant found in our village.
translation.de: aus Wurzeln der Kuntisuyu, einer Pflanze unseres Dorfs.

translation.en: Interesting. Give it to the llamas of the Inca.
translation.de: Interessant. Gibt sie den Lamas. Inti hat gesprochen.

translation.en: Inti has spoken. Next!
translation.de: Gibt sie den Lamas. Inti hat gesprochen. Der Nächste!

translation.en: Great Inca, our people, the Kollasuyo,
have crafted for you this cloak,
with the feathers of the rare luta bird from the White Mountains.
translation.de: aus Federn des Luta aus dem Weißen Gebirge.

translation.en: A rare bird that gets so easily caught has no glamour.
translation.de: Ein Vogel, der sich fangen lässt, hat keinen Glanz.

translation.en: This cloak is not a cloak, it's a rug.
translation.de: Das ist kein Umhang, sondern ein Vorleger.

translation.en: Inti has spoken. It's the Great Inca.
He's being carried on some sort of tray by servants.
translation.de: Er wird von seinen Dienern getragen.

translation.en: That helps with the stairs.
Next!
Great Inca, we have walked all the way from the riverbanks
translation.de: Großer Inka, wir kamen den weiten Weg vom Fluß her,

translation.en: to bring you this basket of fresh fish.
translation.de: um euch diese Fische zu bringen.

translation.en: Not in the mood for fish.
But, Great Inca... we have run nine suns nonstop and--
translation.de: Aber großer Inka, wir liefen neun Tage lang...

translation.en: Inti has spoken.
Out! Next!
Oh, Great Inca!
Accept this offering from a remote village.
translation.de: Akzeptiert dieses Opfer aus einem abgelegenen Dorf.

translation.en: Its people wish to express their deep gratitude
for your radiant protection
and are now entirely devoted to Inti, their only god.
translation.de: und akzeptieren jetzt Inti als ihren alleinigen Gott.

translation.en: Our huaca!
-I'll have a word with this Great Inca. -No, wait. Let me handle it.
translation.de: -Unsere Huaca. -Den knöpfe ich mir vor. Nein, ich mache das.

translation.en: Make way for the chasquis of the Inca!
translation.de: Macht Platz für die Chasquis der Inka.

translation.en: These are some very tiny chasquis.
Oh, Great Inca,
we bring you a very big...
important message.
As big as you, no doubt.
Very well. Speak!
Just as soon as Your Lightness agrees to repair a great injustice.
translation.de: Sobald der Erleuchtete bereit ist, ein Unrecht wiedergutzumachen.

translation.en: How dare you address the Son of the Sun with such arrogance?
translation.de: Ihr wagt es, so mit dem Sohn der Sonne zu reden?

translation.en: You are bold, tiny chasqui. How amusing.
translation.de: Sehr mutig, kleine Chasqui, und amüsant.

translation.en: Continue.
Your great collector here stole this huaca. It belongs to our village.
translation.de: Euer Eintreiber stahl unserem Dorf die Huaca.

translation.en: You must give it back to us.
Great Inca! The peasants in that village are nothing but a lazy lot.
translation.de: Großer Inka, die Bauern dieses Dorfes sind alles Faulpelze.

translation.en: They steal! And they lie.
No matter. I already have a whole room filled with these trinkets,
translation.de: Egal, ich habe einen ganzen Saal voller Kinkerlitzchen,

translation.en: bigger and fancier than this one.
Now, return this thing to the tiny chasqui.
translation.de: Gib es dem winzigen Chasqui zurück.

translation.en: No!
Now, let me have my message.
Well, here it is.
Many metal gods have arrived on Mama Cocha, our mother sea.
translation.de: Metallgötter landeten bei Mama Cocha, unserer Meergöttin.

translation.en: On a huge floating house.
They are mighty gods,
spitting fire... and burying everything in their path.
translation.de: speien Feuer und vernichten, was ihnen im Weg ist.

translation.en: And they will destroy the Incas.
Hold him up!
The Great Inca is about to fall!
Woe to the world if he touches the ground.
translation.de: Er darf den Boden nicht berühren.

translation.en: No, that old story again! Invented by the Great Observer!
translation.de: Nicht schon wieder dieses Märchen des Großen Auge.

translation.en: I don't ever want to hear about those so-called metal gods again.
translation.de: Ich will nichts mehr von diesen Metallgöttern hören.

translation.en: No one can destroy the son of Inti!
Throw these tiny liars into the dungeon.
translation.de: Ins Verließ mit den kleinen Lügnern.

translation.en: The pumas will shut them up!
We're not liars! And I'm not tiny!
translation.de: Wir sind weder Lügner noch klein!

translation.en: May the Great Condor strike you and throw you out of your stupid tray!
translation.de: Möge der Große Kondor Euch von Eurem Thron stoßen.

translation.en: Did I do this?
I am a powerful shaman.
Guards?
Guards!
Oh, no! Oh, I touched the ground!
translation.de: Oh nein! Ich habe den Boden berührt!

translation.en: I'm all filthy!
translation.de: Ich bin... Ich bin voller Schmutz.

translation.en: Guards!
What is this?
The chasquis were telling the truth!
Pretty weird-looking for gods.
What are you doing? No, that's mine!
translation.de: Was soll das? Das gehört mir.

translation.en: You can't take that. That's my jewelry!
They're not gods. They're thieves!
translation.de: Von wegen Götter, das sind Diebe.

translation.en: -They're monsters! -It's not funny. I want them to stop.
translation.de: Ungeheuer. Das ist nicht witzig. Hört auf. Inti hat gesprochen.

translation.en: Inti has spoken!
translation.de: Das ist nicht witzig. Hört auf. Inti hat gesprochen.

translation.en: Oh, stop, please!
The huaca, quick!
No!
No! It contains our most sacred treasure!
translation.de: Nein! Darin steckt unser wertvollster Schatz.

translation.en: What are you doing?
But it's sacred! No!
Run!
Run!
Don't worry, Naïra. She will find her way back to the village.
translation.de: Keine Angst. Sie findet ins Dorf zurück.

translation.en: Come on.
Hurry! Let's hide.
Oh, no! It's chipped!
Listen! That's condor feathers in there.
translation.de: Hör mal! Da sind Kondorfedern drinnen.

translation.en: Feathers don't make that sound.
Here, run and bring the huaca back to the village.
translation.de: Hier, bring die Huaca zurück ins Dorf.

translation.en: Good luck, Tepulpaï.
Kirkincho?
Oh, you scared me.
You know, I'm glad to have you as a friend.
translation.de: Schön, dich als Freund zu haben.

translation.en: Okay. Now we've gotta get out of here and fast.
translation.de: Ok, jetzt müssen wir schnell hier raus.

translation.en: Naïra and Lamita need us. Do you smell something?
translation.de: Naïra und Lamita brauchen uns. Riechst du was?

translation.en: Go on. Find the exit!
Hurry, Kirkincho! We don't want the pumas to catch us.
translation.de: Los, Kirkincho, bevor uns die Pumas fangen.

translation.en: Is this the way?
Oh, come on! With you, it's always eat, eat, eat.
translation.de: Ach komm, du denkst nur ans Essen.

translation.en: You're such a selfish glutton.
Back off, Puma! You're facing the power of the Great Condor!
translation.de: Hau ab, Puma, ich habe die Kraft des Großen Kondors.

translation.en: You have nothing to fear!
This puma is the sun of my night.
He is my eyes. He keeps me company.
translation.de: Er ist mein Augenlicht. Er ist mein Gefährte.

translation.en: And what is your name, little one?
Tepulpaï. And I'm not little.
I need to get out of this place as fast as possible to go find my friend Naïra.
translation.de: Ich muss hier raus und meine Freundin Naïra finden.

translation.en: The men of metal are chasing her, and they want to steal--
I should have known. They are the ones who make the ground tremble.
translation.de: Ich hätte es wissen müssen. Sie erschüttern den Boden.

translation.en: You know them?
I saw them in the stars a long time ago.
translation.de: Ich sah sie vor langer Zeit in den Sternen.

translation.en: Men of metal, with hair on their chins,
translation.de: Männer aus Metall mit Haaren am Kinn

translation.en: would come on Mama Cocha.
And I know what they're capable of.
translation.de: Ich weiß, wozu sie fähig sind.

translation.en: Oh, so you're the Great Observer. Well, the Great Inca said you were a liar.
translation.de: Du bist das Große Auge. Der Große Inka nannte dich Lügner.

translation.en: Yes! He didn't believe me! But he was wrong, it seems.
translation.de: Ja, er hat mir nicht geglaubt, aber das war wohl ein Fehler.

translation.en: The men of metal attacked him, and they took everything from him.
And, you know? He touched the ground! So now, you can get out, too.
translation.de: Er berührte den Boden. Du kannst jetzt hier raus.

translation.en: Alas, there is no way out of the labyrinth.
translation.de: Leider gibt es keinen Weg aus diesem Labyrinth.

translation.en: Oh, you are soaking wet!
Forgive my lack of hospitality.
I've been living alone here for so long.
translation.de: Ich war zu lange hier unten.

translation.en: Come, dry off in my chamber.
Pachamama, thank you for feeding me here in the depths of your belly.
translation.de: Pachamama, danke, dass du mich auch in diesen Tiefen nährst.

translation.en: You know, before they threw me into this hole,
translation.de: Bevor ich in dieses Loch geworfen wurde,

translation.en: I was the Great Observer of the Inca.
translation.de: war ich das Große Auge der Inka.

translation.en: Yes, the Sun Gazer!
I worshiped Inti, our sun god.
translation.de: Ich betete unseren Sonnengott Inti an.

translation.en: -Really? -Yes.
And now, here I am.
Forever deprived of light.
Such irony! I have become the Shadow Gazer.
translation.de: Welch Ironie. Ich wurde zum Schattenseher.

translation.en: Grateful for this puma to keep me company.
translation.de: Ich bin dankbar, diesen Puma zu haben.

translation.en: You'll see.
You'll get used to it in time.
Just like me.
I don't wanna get used to it. I want to go home with Naïra,
translation.de: Das will ich gar nicht. Ich will nach Hause mit Naïra, Lamita, Kirkincho und der Huaca.

translation.en: Lamita, Kirkincho, and our huaca.
translation.de: Ich will nach Hause mit Naïra, Lamita, Kirkincho und der Huaca.

translation.en: Anger breathes crazy ideas through your head, my boy.
translation.de: Zorn bringt dich nur auf verrückte Ideen, mein Junge.

translation.en: I hate the Incas and the men of metal. They're thieves.
translation.de: Ich hasse die Inka und die Metallmänner. Sie sind Diebe.

translation.en: -They want to steal our huaca! -And have you never taken anything
translation.de: Sie wollen unsere Huaca! Hast du noch nie etwas ohne Erlaubnis genommen?

translation.en: without permission?
translation.de: Hast du noch nie etwas ohne Erlaubnis genommen?

translation.en: Get some rest, little one.
And learn to gaze upon your own shadows.
translation.de: Und lerne, über deinen eigenen Schatten hinauszublicken.

translation.en: Forgive me, Great Condor, for taking that feather...
translation.de: Verzeih mir, Großer Kondor, ich nahm deine Feder

translation.en: and for lying to the shaman.
I know how to get out!
Shadow Gazer, come with me!
Come on!
My poor child,
no one can leave the realm of shadows.
translation.de: Niemand verlässt das Reich der Schatten.

translation.en: The Great Condor is the master of the wind. He will guide me.
translation.de: Der Große Kondor beherrscht den Wind. Er führt mich.

translation.en: You're wasting your time.
I have warned you!
Thank you, Great Condor. Thank you for leading me out of that labyrinth.
translation.de: Danke, Großer Kondor, dass du mir den Weg gezeigt hast.

translation.en: You're here!
I've been so worried.
Are you all right?
Thank you!
The Great Condor will fly us back to the village.
translation.de: Der Große Kondor fliegt uns zurück.

translation.en: No! This time, I'm not leaving Lamita!
translation.de: Nein, dieses Mal kommt Lamita mit.

translation.en: It's up to you now, Kirkincho!
-Come on! Go, now! -Hurry!
Naïra! This is just like in my dream.
translation.de: Naïra, das ist wie in meinem Traum.

translation.en: Look how beautiful Pachamama is from the sky.
translation.de: Wie schön Pachamama von hier oben aussieht.

translation.en: Oh, no!
The Great Condor is losing its feathers.
Look. He's hurt!
Condor!
Condor, wake up!
Naïra, we've gotta jump!
-Ready? -Yes.
Now!
Is it broken?
No, just a bump. I'll be okay.
translation.de: Nur eine Beule. Das wird wieder.

translation.en: It is broken.
Oh, poor huaca!
Do you think the Great Condor crashed?
I don't know, but we don't have much time. The men in metal will be here soon.
translation.de: Keine Ahnung, aber wir müssen los. Die Metallmänner kommen.

translation.en: Here, take the huaca and protect her.
translation.de: Hier, pass auf die Huaca auf.

translation.en: I'll run to the village to alert the shaman and Walumama.
translation.de: Ich warne den Schamanen und Walumama.

translation.en: -Tepulpaï! -What?
Think twicing!
Think twicing to you, too, Naïra!
Think twicing.
I must protect the huaca, so...
translation.de: Ich muss die Huaca beschützen, also...

translation.en: take her very far away.
Or hide her... in the cave!
translation.de: Oder ich verstecke sie in der Höhle.

translation.en: No, 'cause of the snakes.
The Condor.
Condor!
Great Condor!
Shaman?
I'm sorry for the bumpy landing.
-Did you get hurt? -I'm fine.
I'm fine.
Our people need you, Tepulpaï.
Run to the cave, and bring the huaca back to the ancestors.
translation.de: Lauf zur Höhle und gib den Ahnen die Huaca zurück.

translation.en: Go faster than the wind.
Yes, Shaman.
Naïra!
translation.de: Naïra! Ist Tepulpaï nicht bei dir?

translation.en: -Isn't Tepulpaï with you? -Naïra, where's Tepulpaï?
translation.de: Naïra! Ist Tepulpaï nicht bei dir? Wo ist Tepulpaï?

translation.en: All of you go hide behind the cacti, quick! The men of metal are coming!
translation.de: Versteckt euch hinter den Kakteen. Die Metallmänner kommen.

translation.en: -Where's the shaman? -He left the village to find you.
translation.de: -Wo ist der Schamane? -Er wollte euch suchen.

translation.en: -You didn't see him? -No. And Walumama?
The shaman...
tried his best.
The snakes are the keepers of our cave.
translation.de: Das sind die Hüter der Höhlen.

translation.en: They can recognize who is ready to appear before our ancestors.
translation.de: Sie erkennen, wer bereit ist, unsere Ahnen zu treffen.

translation.en: -You must trust them. -You must trust them.
Hopefully, it'll work.
They mustn't find us.
I love you!
No, not Pachamama's well!
No!
This is Pachamama's well!
You have no right to take what's inside of it!
translation.de: Die Sachen stehen euch nicht zu.

translation.en: Watch out! They will make the ground shake!
Stand back!
It's so dark. I can't see.
translation.de: In der Dunkelheit sehe ich nichts.

translation.en: Ancestors, I have brought the huaca back to you.
translation.de: Ahnen, ich bringe euch die Huaca zurück.

translation.en: It's a bit...
smashed,
I know. But the men of metal are here to attack our village.
translation.de: Ich weiß. Aber die Metallmänner greifen unser Dorf an.

translation.en: We really need her protection.
Pachamama never forgives.
Fire! There's a fire!
Shaman! Are you hurt?
Hurry! Bring me my drum. Is Tepulpaï back?
translation.de: Bring mir meine Trommel. Ist Tepulpaï zurück?

translation.en: No!
Thank you, ancestors.
Walumama!
-Thank you, Walumama! -Thank you, Walumama!
It's over, Tepulpaï. Come on.
Come on! Hurry!
Wow! You're not such a coward, after all! Let's go!
translation.de: Wow, du bist doch nicht feige. Los!

translation.en: -Over here! Put it out! -Hurry, we need more!
The fire! It's burning our fields!
Look! The shaman is calling for the rain!
translation.de: Da! Der Schamane bittet um Regen.

translation.en: Oh, no! Please, Shaman, don't give up!
The Inca stole all our crops.
We have nothing left to eat. And no more seeds to sow.
translation.de: -Wir haben nichts zum Essen. -Und kein Saatgut.

translation.en: What are we going to do?
Why, Shaman? Why are such calamities striking our village?
translation.de: Warum trifft uns so ein Unheil, Schamane?

translation.en: Pachamama hears us no more.
I found these in the huaca.
But these are...
These are seeds!
Quinoa, corn, and potato seeds!
As old as our ancestors.
Pachamama, our mother.
These three seeds you stored in the huaca
translation.de: Diese drei Samen aus der Huaca

translation.en: are the last seeds we have left.
We give them to you.
May this offering feed your belly.
It's raining!
Tepulpaï and Naïra, our two little saviors.
translation.de: Tepulpaï und Naïra, unsere zwei kleinen Retter.

translation.en: Tepulpaï, you have grown so much.
translation.de: Tepulpaï, du bist so reif geworden.

translation.en: I see the Great Condor in you.
translation.de: Ich sehe den Großen Kondor in dir.

translation.en: Now, dance for Pachamama, little Shaman.
translation.de: Jetzt tanz für Pachamama, kleiner Schamane.
